resolution_robustness.claim: AR(2) eigenvalue estimates are robust to 2× resolution change (1h vs 2h)
resolution_robustness.evidence: Clock mean |λ| identical (0.7655 vs 0.7654), genome-wide differs by only 0.029
resolution_robustness.caveat: AR(2) preference drops from 95.6% to 52.9% with fewer timepoints (statistical power issue, not eigenvalue bias)

translational_amplification.claim: Translational regulation may amplify circadian persistence hierarchy
translational_amplification.evidence: Ribosome footprint clock mean |λ|=0.8506 vs total RNA 0.7654, gap 0.2455 vs 0.2069
translational_amplification.caveat: Single dataset, no statistical test of RNA vs ribosome difference, could reflect translational buffering

human_disruption_direction.caveat: Only 6 sleep dep timepoints (marginal for AR(2)), opposite to naive disruption prediction, may reflect homeostatic pressure buildup

hierarchy_universality.claim: Clock > target hierarchy is preserved across datasets and resolutions
hierarchy_universality.evidence: All 3 mouse liver analyses show clock > target: gaps +0.13, +0.21, +0.25
hierarchy_universality.caveat: Only tested in mouse liver; no gene-level hierarchy test in human blood (probe IDs)

affected_convergence_points.update: Test E confirmed 25-30% nonlinear deviation is universal across all ODE models
affected_convergence_points.new_confidence: Claims about exact |λ| values should include ±25-30% uncertainty from linearization
AR(2) cannot detect primary Boman disease mechanism
affected_convergence_points.still_valid: Direction of APC-KO perturbation correctly predicted

affected_convergence_points.update: 21-34% deviation found in ALL five canonical ODE models
affected_convergence_points.new_confidence: This is a universal property of linearized observation, not a Boman-specific failure
affected_convergence_points.still_valid: AR(2) captures dynamical class even with quantitative bias

test_e_updates.unaffected_convergence_points: Most of 22 convergence mappings remain valid because they rely on relative comparisons (clock>target ordering, cross-species hierarchy, disruption direction) which survive nonlinear distortion
